perturbation.original_text: All sales made by the Agent of the Kallo Mobile care suite of products shall create a Book of Business owned by  the Agent, which constitutes all funds due to Agent under this agreement flowing from each sale for a period not to  exceed 36 months from the date of acceptance by Kallo of the Client EULA or until the EULA terminates under the  provision that are outlined therein of the Kallo Mobile care suite of products.
perturbation.changed_text: All sales made by the Agent of the Kallo Mobile care suite of products may create a Book of Business owned by the Agent, subject to Kallo's approval. The duration and ownership of the Book of Business will be determined at Kallo's sole discretion on a case-by-case basis, considering factors such as market conditions and Agent performance.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that all sales create a 'Book of Business' owned by the Agent, with a fixed 36-month duration. The modified version introduces uncertainty by making the creation of a Book of Business conditional upon Kallo's approval and removing the fixed term, thus creating a direct contradiction with the prior statement.
perturbation.location: 2.KALLO SALES AGENT PROGRAM TERMS AND CONDITIONS, d)

perturbation.original_text: Exclusivity is granted for the region of Nigeria, The Agent is expected to confirm the first  purchase order as per Schedule D with the down payment within thee (3) months of execution of this agreement and  in order to retain the exclusivity of the territory the Agent shall achieve the target commitment in Schedule D.
perturbation.changed_text: Exclusivity may be granted for the region of Nigeria, subject to Kallo's ongoing evaluation of the Agent's performance. Kallo reserves the right to appoint additional agents or directly engage in sales activities within Nigeria at any time, regardless of the Agent's fulfillment of Schedule D commitments.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants exclusivity for Nigeria, contingent upon meeting Schedule D targets. The modified text directly contradicts this by stating that exclusivity 'may be granted' and reserving Kallo's right to appoint other agents or sell directly, regardless of the Agent's performance. This creates uncertainty about the Agent's exclusive rights.
perturbation.location: 2.KALLO SALES AGENT PROGRAM TERMS AND CONDITIONS, f)

perturbation.original_text: Kallo shall not allow another Agent to solicit the existing Agents book of business  unless it is understood by all parties the end user client desires the transfer. Kallo shall use its best reasonable  efforts to protect the Agent from aggressive solicitation by another Agent taking any part of the Agent's book of  Business.
perturbation.changed_text: Kallo may allow another Agent to solicit the existing Agent's book of business at its sole discretion, irrespective of the end user client's desires. Kallo's obligation to protect the Agent from aggressive solicitation is limited to actions Kallo deems appropriate in the ordinary course of business.
perturbation.explanation: The original text protects the Agent's book of business, allowing solicitation by another agent only if the end-user client desires the transfer. The modified version gives Kallo discretion to allow solicitation irrespective of the client's desires. Additionally, the original text mandates 'best reasonable efforts' to protect the Agent, while the modified text reduces this obligation to 'actions Kallo deems appropriate,' thereby weakening protection and creating ambiguity.
